channel.title: Help rep++
channel.description:
k sometimes when im doing my server i keep getting. 'else' without 'if'
what does that exactly mean?

item.title: Help rep++
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xxxxxx 13, post:3, topic:383178”]actually its not else if { its refering to.

Its

if {

}
else {
}

cases its refering to. When you make an if statement you are saying
IF (this is true) { DO THIS SHIT
}

else {
do this shit
}

and else without an if is saying that:
if (this is true) is just a statement saying otherwise do this (else phrase). but you can’t OTHERWISE something if there is no Other.

so you need to add an if statement. Or do what most people do and just remove the Else Tag.[/quote]

He is correct, its just some simple coding, i use a free tool called Notepad++. Its great for noob coders like me. now what it does if you open a file (client.java) its reads the language and puts it in that format. and then it will highlight specific things telling you basically all you need to know about it. Say you open your client.java and search for oh idk “commands” looking for the commands command (<< sounds weird lmao) and it would then have specific parts highlighed in different colors saying they are bases of that operation. and then each set of these {} are connected on the side showing you that they are full parts. i dont exactly know how to explain it. But feel free to download this noob-friendly tool at notepad-plus-plus.org and one last thing about it, it dosent just do .java files. it has a total of like 30 different computer languages, Epic right??

Read full topic

item.title: Help rep++
item.dc:creator: @xxxxxx_13 xxxxxx 13
item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

actually its not else if { its refering to.

Its

if {

}
else {
}

cases its refering to. When you make an if statement you are saying
IF (this is true) { DO THIS SHIT
}

else {
do this shit
}

and else without an if is saying that:
if (this is true) is just a statement saying otherwise do this (else phrase). but you can’t OTHERWISE something if there is no Other.

so you need to add an if statement. Or do what most people do and just remove the Else Tag.

Read full topic
